alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Gulf, south central Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida and southwestern Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida through 545 PM EDT/445 PM CDT/... At 459 PM EDT/359 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stonemill Creek, or 16 miles southwest of Blountstown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stonemill Creek, Orange, Wewahitchka, Vilas, Chipola Cutoff, Jensen Place, Central City, Red Hill, Marysville, Scotts Ferry, Estiffanulga, Kern, Wilma, Kinard, Lewis, Nixon Garden, Chipola Park, Twin Pole and Sumatra. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty
